titles.title: God was at work in the garden,

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
God was at work in the garden,
Creation was hardly begun;
He took some earth and He shaped it
To fashion a created son;
Adam lay lifeless and empty
At the end of creation's sixth day,
When God breathed His breath in his nostrils
Putting treasure in vessels of clay.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
CHORUS
Treasures in vessels of clay,
Riches in jars made of earth;
If you never look past the external
You'll never behold their true worth.
For God has put in us His spirit
His life and His truth there to stay,
And though we're not much on the outside
We are treasure in vessels of clay.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
The Midianites covered the valley
An army dreadful in might;
Gideon with three hundred soldiers
Surrounded their camp in the night.
The blast on the trumpet was sounded
'The sword of the Lord,' they did say;
Light shone from their pitchers, now broken
For the treasure's in vessels of clay.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Adam abandoned his treasure
No more did he know divine breath:
A Saviour was needed from heaven
To ransom our souls out of death.
Jesus was sent by His Father
The price for rebellion to pay;
Though many did not recognise it
He was treasure in a vessel of clay.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
As history continues its progress
Creation is groaning so loud.
The poor and the weak are neglected
For the rich and the strong are so proud;
But God is raising a people,
His kingdom will soon hold full sway
And He'll free the travailing creation
Using treasure from vessels of clay.
